title: NextEra Energy Resources and Sysco collaborate to develop plan to reduce the foodservice leader's carbon emissions ... - PR Newswire
summary: NextEra Energy Resources will work with Sysco Corporation to develop tailored solutions to support Sysco's goal of reducing their carbon footprint by 27.5% by 2030. NextEra Energy Resources will develop and implement a customized suite of solutions including large scale renewable energy projects, on-site renewable generation, retail renewables, reliability infrastructure and active energy management services. The agreement bolsters the companies' shared commitment to decarbonization and paves the way for a cleaner and more sustainable future.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a range of renewable energy solutions, that can be categorized as green innovations as they contribute to environmental sustainability goals by  reducing or replacing harmful substances, reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy, and  the protection of biological systems.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a range of renewable energy solutions, that can be categorized as business innovations as they are new or improved products or business processes that differ significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE, the article describes renewable energy solutions such as solar and wind power. These would fall under green products as they are designed and manufactured to reduce their environmental impact throughout their life cycle, including minimizing energy consumption, using sustainable production processes, and using environmentally benign materials.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe any specific green processes.

title: Kohler Co. Outlines Strategy, Ambitions, and Progress in 2022 ESG Report - Contractor Magazine
summary: Kohler Co. released its 2022 ESG report detailing the company's progress in environmental sustainability, diversity, and social impact. Kohler has made strides in reducing GHG emissions, water and waste intensity, promoting diversity and inclusion, and supporting communities through its various programs and partnerships.
green_innovation: TRUE, Kohler's expansion of its efforts to promote energy resiliency and resource conservation, as well as innovations in renewable and clean energy solutions demonstrate its commitment to environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE, Kohler's launch of HeatCapture™, a double wall stainless steel heat exchanger, is a new and improved business process that differs significantly from the firm's previous business processes.
green_product: TRUE, Kohler's continued expansion of global EPD and Declare label product transparency offerings, as well as its launch of a porcelain pour flush toilet (Kohler Rinse) for communities without access to piped water and electricity demonstrate the company's commitment to green product innovation.
green_process: TRUE, Kohler's partnership with Polar explorer Robert Swan on his excursion through Antarctica to the Geographic South Pole where he relied only on renewable energy sources demonstrates the company's innovation in green processes.

title: Kohler Launches Limited-Edition Heritage Colors Collection in Spring Green and Peachblow - Yahoo Finance
summary: Kohler, celebrating its 150th anniversary, has launched the Heritage Colors Collection, featuring vintage Spring Green and Peachblow colors on select kitchen and bath products. Designers Justina Blakeney and Jonathan Adler showcase unique bathroom spaces with Heritage Colors Collection products, demonstrating how color can accentuate personal style in kitchen and bath design. The limited-edition collection includes various Kohler products in Spring Green and Peachblow, available for a limited time.

business_innovation: TRUE - The Heritage Colors Collection is a business innovation because it is a new product line that differs significantly from Kohler's previous products and has been introduced to the market.
green_product: TRUE - The Heritage Colors Collection products are green products because they are designed to be durable and long-lasting, reducing the need for frequent replacements and conserving resources.
green_process: FALSE - The article does not describe a green process.

title: Qcells maintains No. 1 position in both U.S. residential & commercial solar market segments - PR Newswire
summary: Qcells continues to dominate the U.S. residential and commercial solar markets, according to Wood Mackenzie's Q2 2023 U.S. PV Leaderboard Report. With a 35% market share, Qcells has held the No. 1 spot in the residential solar market for 15 consecutive quarters and in the commercial segment for over four years. The company's success is attributed to its high-quality solar panels and its commitment to developing turnkey energy solutions.

title: Risen Energy Signs 1GW HJT Module Supply Agreement with Athein - Canada NewsWire
summary: Risen Energy, a leading solar company, has signed a supply agreement with Athein Holding Pte Ltd, an independent power producer (IPP) platform company, to provide up to 1 GWp of cutting-edge Heterojunction with Intrinsic Thin layer (HJT) photovoltaic modules. This partnership will support Athein Holding Pte Ltd's mission to acquire, develop, build, and operate utility-scale and rooftop solar projects in Southeast Asia and India. HJT technology is a cutting-edge PV technology that combines high efficiency with low degradation, offering superior performance compared to traditional PV modules.

title: Shifting the EV sector to the next gear - The Borneo Post
summary: Malaysia is ramping up its effort to grow the nascent EV industry by introducing policies to push the uptake of EVs in the domestic market, including tax exemptions and the development of charging infrastructure. The entry of Tesla and other global automakers into the Malaysian market is seen as a sign of confidence in the country's EV potential. The article highlights the Southeast Asia region's growing demand for EVs, with the market expected to grow significantly in the coming years.

green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a green process.

title: Toray Set to Increase Carbon Fiber Capacity to Meet Growing Demand in Pressure Vessel Applications - PR Newswire
summary: Toray Composite Materials America, Inc. (Toray CMA) is expanding its carbon fiber facility in Spartanburg, SC to meet the growing demand for clean energy solutions. The expansion will increase the supply of carbon fiber for compressed natural gas, hydrogen tanks, and other pressure vessel applications. Toray CMA is a primary supplier of carbon fiber to the alternative energy, hydrogen economy, and clean energy revolution.

business_innovation: TRUE, the expansion of the carbon fiber facility is a business innovation because it is a new or improved business process that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes.
green_product: TRUE, the carbon fiber produced at the expanded facility will be used to make green products, such as compressed natural gas and hydrogen tanks.
green_process: TRUE, the carbon fiber production process at the expanded facility will be a green process because it will minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
